results.title: Madonna of the seven moons
results.creator_credit: Arthur Crabtree, R.J. Minney and Gainsborough Pictures
results.brief_description: Maddalena is a rich and respectable wife and mother, who occasionally abandons her Roman villa to go and live in Florence as Rosanna, the mistress of a handsome gipsy criminal. Like the classic horror film it is a drama rooted in sexual repression, using schizophrenia and amnesia rather than the fantastic. “Madonna of the Seven Moons” is based on the novel “The Madonna of Seven Moons” by Margery Lawrence and stars Stewart Granger, Phyllis Calvert and Patricia Roc.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arthur Crabtree, R.J. Minney and Gainsborough Pictures

results.title: Full moon in Paris = Les Nuits de la pleine lune
results.creator_credit: Eric Rohmer, Margaret Menegoz, Les Films Ariane, Les Films du Losange and Acteurs Auteurs Associes
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Comedies et proverbes”.
He who has two women loses his soul is the cryptic message at the start of this film in Eric Rohmer’s “Comedies et proverbes” cycle. The he of the message is, in this instance, a she - Louise who cannot bear being “loved too much”. And so she plays a game of seduction with her two aspiring lovers, one of whom she loves too, in her own way. And what if they get tired of waiting, of being available? Pascale Ogier won the best actress award at Venice in 1984 for her role as Louise. She is supported by Tcheky Karyo and Fabrice Luchini.
results.title_for_label: Full moon in Paris = Les Nuits de la pleine lune

results.title: Boyfriends and girlfriends = L'Ami de mon amie
results.creator_credit: Eric Rohmer, Margaret Menegoz, Sofica Investimage and Les Films du Losange
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Comedies et proverbes”.
Illustrating the phrase “the friends of my friends are my friends”, “Boyfriends and girlfriends” begins as a comedy of perversity involving mismatched couples, in one of the new satellite cities ringing Paris. What makes it such fun is the freshness that Rohmer is able to bring to his film. There’s a vast dichotomy between what the characters say and do (or won’t say and won’t do) and the manicured man-made environment of Cergy-Pontoise. It is between those lines of dialogue and architecture that the film’s punch and spirit rests. Wistful, poignant and tender, this last chapter of Rohmer’s remarkable “Comedies et proverbes” cycle is a perfect place to take in the Gallic charm, elegant poise and cool wit of Eric Rohmer.

results.title: Dot and Santa Claus
results.creator_credit: Yoram Gross and Yoram Gross Films
results.brief_description: When Dot tells Santa Claus all about her wish to find her friend the Kangaroo’s lost Joey he offers to help and the two take to the air in Santa’s sleigh, pulled by two kangaroos. Their quest takes them all around the world and at each stop Santa teaches Dot about special Christmas traditions, including the origin of the Christmas carol “Silent night”. A delightful and entertaining musical adventure that is sure to bring glad tidings to all.

results.title: My fair lady
results.creator_credit: George Cukor, Jack L. Warner and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: The dazzling film version of Lerner and Loewe’s acclaimed musical. Audrey Hepburn stars as the cockney flowergirl Eliza Doolittle who is trained by Professor Higgins (Rex Harrison) to pass as a duchess. Featuring sumptuous cinematography and costumes by Cecil Beaton, this is one of the most popular musicals ever filmed. Winner of eight Academy awards including Best Picture. The original musical is based on George Bernard Shaw’s “Pygmalion”.

results.title: Seven brides for seven brothers (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Stanley Donen, Jack Cummings and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Seven brides for seven brothers is a funny, romantic, physically lively movie musical. It represents a wonderful mix of story, characters, song, ideas and dancing. In Oregon, when Adam Pontipee brings a bride back to the farm after a visit to town, Milly finds that she has to be not only a wife, but also mother to her brothers-in-law. The six brothers listen to Adam’s story of the sobbin’ women and decide to steal brides for themselves. Starring Howard Keel and Jane Powell.

results.title: The Brothers Karamazov
results.creator_credit: Richard Brooks, Pandro S. Berman, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Avon
results.brief_description: Based on Dostoyevsky’s masterful story of greed, vindictiveness and lust, “The Brothers Karamazov” brings 19th century Czarist Russia to life in a lavish dramatic production. Karamazov, is the father of four wildly disparate sons: a sterile intellectual, the saintly Alexey, an illegitimate schemer and the feckless oldest son, Dmitri who is in love with the same elusive woman as his father. They all stand to gain an inheritance from their father and together they weave a web of intrigue and murder. A wonderfully woven tale of sin and salvation, the film stars Yul Brynner, Maria Schell, Lee J. Cobb, Claire Bloom, Richard Basehart and William Shatner.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Brooks, Pandro S. Berman, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Avon

results.title: Young Einstein (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Yahoo Serious, David Roach, Warwick Ross and Serious Productions
results.brief_description: A comedy based on the premise that Albert Einstein not only developed the theory of relativity but also invented rock ‘n roll. Albert Einstein sails the world, falls in love with the world’s most intelligent and beautiful girl, Marie Curie, creates the first surfboard, invents the electric guitar and uses rock ‘n roll to save the planet from atomic destruction. Virtually a one-man tour de force by Yahoo Serious and co-starring Odile le Clezio.

results.title: Carry on up the Khyber (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers, Peter Rogers Productions and Rank Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Carry on”.
It is 1895 and the British occupation of India is threatened by revolutionary uprisings. In order for the revolutionaries to attack the British troops they need to cross the notorious Khyber Pass. The history and politics of the British Raj, however, is simply a convenient background for the Carry On team to conduct their regular mix of hilarious slap-stick and tongue-in-cheek camp. Cast includes Sidney James, Kenneth Williams, Joan Sims and a large supporting cast of British comedians.

results.title: Carry on doctor (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Carry on”.
Britain’s favourite comedy team “carry on” as they only know how! “Carry on Doctor” looks at life in a country hospital when the patients revolt against the staff. Hattie Jacques is the fearsome Matron, Kenneth Williams the cold-hearted Doctor Tinkle, while Sid James as the malingerer Mr. Roper, takes a vacation in hospital. A madcap romp of bandages and stethoscopes, Frankie Howard as Mr. Bigger hams it up while Charles Hawtrey gives an unforgettable performance as an expectant father suffering all the symptoms of pregnancy.
